pull.title: kernel:  add serialization method for btck_BlockHeader API
pull.body:
This adds serialization for `btck_BlockHeader` API. Also, updated the `CheckHandle` to compare the byte content instead of size.

Follow-up to #33822 .

events.message: add: serialization method for block header in the kernel api. Also, fix CheckHandle to compare the byte content instead of sizes.

events.body:

- return fixed length buffer instead of writer [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34401#discussion_r2732726790)
- Addressed [nit](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34401#discussion_r2732719066)

comments.body:
For consistency with other serialization function documentation, would be good to add 

> This is consensus serialization that is also used for the P2P network.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -1768,6 +1768,20 @@ BITCOINKERNEL_API int32_t BITCOINKERNEL_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT btck_block_header_get
 BITCOINKERNEL_API uint32_t BITCOINKERNEL_WARN_UNUSED_RESULT btck_block_header_get_nonce(
     const btck_BlockHeader* header) BITCOINKERNEL_ARG_NONNULL(1);
 
+/**
+ * @brief Serializes the btck_BlockHeader through the passed in callback to bytes.
+ *
+ * @param[in] header    Non-null.
+ * @param[in] writer    Non-null, callback to a write bytes function.
+ * @param[in] user_data Holds a user-defined opaque structure that will be
+ *                      passed back through the writer callback.
+ * @return              0 on success.
+ */
+BITCOINKERNEL_API int btck_block_header_to_bytes(

comments.body: I think as a defensive mechanism, we should still use try-catch here to ensure exceptions never cross the C API boundary, even though header serialization shouldn't fail under normal circumstances.
